repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Tirikaṭukam, text with a commentary. This commentary does not correspond to that of the Kaḻakam 1966 edition. The text is incomplete: Kāppu + stanzas 1-91 only. The commentary ends with the word muṟṟum.

extent.note: The leaves are broader in their middle than at their edges.

collation.desc: 46 folios = Tirikaṭukam: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-49.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation. Boreholes.

layoutDesc.layout: Two-column layout with 4-line stanza in the left column and commentary in the right column. The f1r and f1v leave room for the second hole and thus have three columns, afterwards one short column up to the hole for the verse and the broader right column for the commentary.

handNote.desc: Transitional script with modern ṟa and occasionally double kompu.

binding.p: A single hole to the left side.

origin.origDate: Bundle not dated by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Kaṭukam. 1966. Kaṭukam, Kaṭikai, Māmūlam patavurai viḷakkavuraiyuṭaṉ. [no editor]. Ceṉṉai: Tirunelvēlit teṉṉintiya caivacittānta nūṟpatippuk kaḻakam, 1966.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois et malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 15, no. 74.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In Variétés orientales, 177‒224. Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 22r, no. 74.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
